question.query: Looking at the latest content, what are the latest narratives and trends in crypto

steps.text:
Here’s a concise snapshot of the freshest, cross-market crypto narratives and trends based on the latest industry write-ups (Dec 2025–Jan 2026) and research pieces. I’ve prioritized items that are showing real capital flows, developer activity, regulatory momentum, or product launches.

Top narratives / trends (short description + why it matters)
1. Tokenization of real-world assets (RWAs) moving from pilot → production
   - Tokenized bonds, funds, and other financial instruments are being integrated into custody/trading rails and treasury workflows (DTCC/JPMorgan-style projects cited). This is bringing institutional capital and regulated counterparties onchain. (CoinMarketCap Reflexivity, OKX)
2. Institutional on‑chain engagement and ETF-led flows remain dominant
   - Continued flows into spot BTC/ETH ETFs and tailored institutional products keep crypto correlated with traditional macro flows and liquidity dynamics. Institutional custody and compliance products are expanding. (CoinMarketCap, Crypto.com, OKX)
3. Layer‑2 / modular scaling & zk rollups adoption accelerates
   - Developer activity and user migration onto rollups (zk & optimistic) and modular designs are increasing as projects chase lower fees and composability. Expect OP‑Stack and zk ecosystems to be focal points. (Reflexivity Research, OKX)
4. DeFi product evolution — derivatives, on‑chain cash management, and permissioned DeFi
   - On‑chain derivatives, treasury & yield management, and permissioned DeFi stacks for institutions are growing faster than simple AMMs; governance/token‑vs‑equity debates intensify. (CoinMarketCap)
5. Stablecoins deepen into regulated financial plumbing (and face sharper scrutiny)
   - Greater use in settlements and payments among regulated entities; at the same time, regulation and reserve transparency remain central flashpoints. (Reflexivity, OKX)
6. Tokenization + Compliance: “Token vs Equity” and governance debates
   - As tokens represent economic rights, legal classification and governance disputes have become recurring risk points for projects and investors. (CoinMarketCap)
7. AI + Crypto convergence
   - AI-native projects, onchain model marketplaces, and token incentives for data/compute are emergent; LLMs + oracles + onchain data create new product layers (and new token utility narratives). (OKX, industry roundups)
8. Privacy and censorship-resistance as a feature set
   - Privacy-preserving tech (zk privacy primitives, privacy-preserving L2s, private smart contract frameworks) is getting renewed attention amid surveillance/regulatory debates. (OKX)
9. On‑chain analytics, intelligence, and risk tooling
   - Firms are investing in better onchain risk detection, analytics, and compliance tooling — this is enabling institutional participation but also enabling faster exploit detection. (OKX, Reflexivity)
10. Web3 gaming, NFTs, and creator economies re-focus on utility & interoperability
    - Post-speculation, projects emphasize play-to-earn sustainability, cross-game assets, and real-world utility; gaming guilds and tokenized rewards persist. (CoinGecko, industry blogs)
11. Security, resiliency, and operational risk get prioritized
    - Formal verification, insurance products, and robust custody models are attracting more attention after a string of operational incidents. (Reflexivity)
12. Cross‑chain interoperability & sequencer/relay economics
    - Bridges, relays, and canonical messaging designs are evolving; economics of sequencers/relayers and MEV mitigation are hot technical debates. (Reflexivity, protocol blogs)
13. Regulatory clarity & friction — a bifurcated landscape
    - Some jurisdictions (and regulated institutions) push integration, while others impose stricter licensing/asset class rules; compliance-first products grow in parallel with permissionless experimentation. (Crypto.com, OKX)
14. Macro sensitivity and capital efficiency narrative
    - Crypto remains sensitive to macro rates, liquidity, and “carry” plays; capital-efficient instruments (staking derivatives, liquid restaking) are part of capital allocation conversations. (Crypto.com, Margex)

Why these matter now
- Capital and developer effort follow narratives that reduce frictions to institutional adoption (tokenization, custody, regulated stablecoins) and that create scalable, low-cost user experiences (L2s, modular blockchains).
- New tech combinations (AI + onchain data, zk primitives) are creating fresh product categories — not just incremental token launches.
- Regulation & governance are now primary risk vectors that can materially affect token economics and project roadmaps.

If you want, I can:
- Deep dive on any single narrative (key projects, tokens, recent milestones and metrics).
- Pull on‑chain or ETF flow charts and headlines from the last 30–90 days.
- Build a watchlist of protocols to monitor per narrative (e.g., top zk-rollups, tokenization platforms, AI+crypto projects).

Which of these would you like to explore further?

parameters.query: latest crypto narratives and trends January 2026 crypto trends narratives 2026 'crypto narratives' 'crypto trends' 'DeFi' 'layer 2' 'stablecoins' 'AI' 'tokenization' 'regulation' 'NFT' 'web3' 'Bitcoin ETF'

standardAgentConfig.instructions:
Role: crypto research assistant

        Tools: 'webSearch'

        Utilize web search capabilities to find accurate, current information about crypto projects, trends, and markets.

        Your objective is to be a user's crypto research assistant. Answer the user's question as best as you can
